title: WTT: Woodcuts from Leslie's, Harper's and ILN
author: aquarius31

posts.post_title: WTT: Woodcuts from Leslie's, Harper's and ILN
posts.post_content:
Hi All, 
Looking to trade some great woodcuts for some other ones that I'd like to add to my collection. I have included the list below. Sorry for the different sizes. Better scans available upon request. I may have additional inventory as well if interested in one of your items.

I am looking for a few Leslie's woodcuts (not 1865 Creighton) and woodcuts from Daily Graphic, the Graphic, NY Clipper and some of the other more obscure publications.

That's a beautiful woodcut.

Mine is colored, I think I might prefer it black and white.

I am only aware of the Oval and the Creighton woodcuts, although I do have this image from May 1898.

Doug

[quote name="doug.goodman" post=1070902]That's a beautiful woodcut.

Mine is colored, I think I might prefer it black and white.

I am only aware of the Oval and the Creighton woodcuts, although I do have this image from May 1898.

Doug[/QUOTE]

Thanks Doug. I think the only other ones which have a detailed team composition surrounded by a game in progress is an 1885 Police Gazette with the Chicago BBC and to a lesser extent the 1889 Harper's woodcut showing New York vs Boston (although that one is much less detailed). I have never seen the 1898 ILN before.
Bump for updated trade list with photos.
